According to a resolution passed by the NABS membership at the 1956 convention,
all dues will be increased slightly in January, 1958,
Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of the NAE3 Radio
Network upon payment of an annual network fee. The Network distributes
approximately ei$it hours of programming, by tape recording, weekly, to
members subscribing to its service. This fee is also baaed on power (with
the same power classifications as membership) and a new station does not have
to pay the full fee until the third year it is in the Network, The fees are:
Class B 250.00 375.00 500.00
Class C 150.00 225.00 300.00
stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from
Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A station
paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2 an hour for
better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in a year. This is
about the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have
further questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
